Thank you, @KizzyPhD, for joining the COVID-19 Community Corps & me tonight to talk about the COVID vaccines. 

If you are working to help educate & empower people, join us at the COVID-19 Community Corps. #WeCanDoThis 

https://t.co/VsmsYB4NKU https://t.co/rrfktG37iy

NEW: U.S. announces plan to share AstraZeneca #COVID19 vaccine doses with the world. 60 million doses to be shared as they become available. 

Global pandemics require global cooperation.

Many of us have seen the heartbreaking & horrifying toll of COVID-19 in India in recent days. 

Today's statement outlines concrete steps being taken by the United States to help address the crisis. The uncontrolled spread of COVID-19 anywhere presents a threat to all nations. /1 https://t.co/QCHeAdCvgK
❤️ Hard to say no when an adorable four year old wants to sit on your lap and give you hugs....even if it’s during a work call! Wouldn’t change it for the world. #WFH #COVID19 https://t.co/2h5JLlY0Zv

Together #WeCanDoThis. /end

Thank you, @alastanford, for joining me earlier this week in conversation with the COVID-19 Community Corps. 

Hearing about the work you & the #BlackDoctorsCOVID19Consortium have been doing to vaccinate thousands of people in Philadelphia was inspiring.

/Thread https://t.co/0aR8HRKunW
I'm looking forward to joining you here in a few moments to share updates on the COVID-19 Response. https://t.co/7z33nf8sDT

Since Jan. 20, we've administered more than 200M doses of the #COVID19 vaccines. That's extraordinary.

Now, we turn to the work ahead. Ending this pandemic requires a people-powered movement. We have the power to help friends & family make a decision that could save their life.

The #WeCanDoThis education campaign also has a toolkit for communicating about COVID-19 vaccines, which you can find here: 

https://t.co/ln9W76R3BE

But it will take all of us stepping up to help the people we love get vaccinated. 

If you are working to help educate & empower people, join us at the COVID-19 Community Corps by signing up here: 

https://t.co/jEZEucsckd 

/end

The research tells us that people want to hear from the people they know & trust when deciding about a #COVID19 vaccine.​

And that's the reason we launched the COVID-19 Community Corps. /2

https://t.co/HBe5WsEZrO

I'm so glad you asked. The misinformation surrounding #COVID19 vaccines can be confusing & even harmful. 

That’s why we are working hard to give people the facts about #COVID19, through a variety of channels—the most important of which is trusted messengers. /1 https://t.co/ztiFhR9bEL
2/ We do know that #COVID19 infection can be dangerous during pregnancy, which is why so many pregnant people have chosen to get vaccinated.
It's an important question, Cathy. The good news is that the evidence we have today shows no safety concerns when it comes to fertility and the #COVID19 vaccines. /1 https://t.co/isofFgZ1Ec
Thank you, everyone, for sending in your #COVID questions. I'm looking forward to answering several of them here in a few minutes. https://t.co/OWssgHwCib

While many pregnant people have chosen to get vaccinated, getting a #COVID19 vaccine during pregnancy is ultimately a personal choice. Talking to a healthcare provider may help your decision on when to get vaccinated. /3

These results matter since pregnant people with #COVID19 have a higher risk of poor health outcomes. CDC will continue to follow data for those vaccinated during the 1st & 2nd trimesters of pregnancy, but growing evidence of vaccine safety during pregnancy is comforting. /2

In a new national study of pregnant people who received the Pfizer or Moderna #COVID19 vaccines, @CDCGov found no evidence of safety concerns for pregnant people vaccinated in the 3rd trimester or for their babies. While follow up data is needed, these findings are reassuring. /1
Here’s an important but often overlooked point: Increasing access to #COVID19 vaccines helps increase vaccine confidence. https://t.co/8uloJbzYzx

If you are feeling alone during this pandemic, you are not broken or weak. If we have learned one thing from #COVID19, it is that we need each other. There is nothing to be ashamed of in needing the help of a family member or a friend.

MYTH: #CovidVaccines can give you #COVID19.

FACT: The vaccines don’t contain live virus. They can’t give you COVID-19. You might feel temporary flu-like symptoms after getting vaccinated, but that’s actually a sign your immune system is responding & building protection.

We have given over 200 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines, 50% of adults have received a dose, and now every adult above 16 years old in the United States is eligible. That’s extraordinary progress. https://t.co/aD9d2VqA5L
Vaccination is the best tool to turn the page on the #COVID19 pandemic. Everyone in the U.S. over age 16 is now eligible for the vaccine. #WeCanDoThis @HHSGov https://t.co/QsnODQ53vG

You do not need a Social Security Number or government ID to receive free COVID-19 services. A facility may ask for this info to help confirm you are uninsured but you will still be treated, tested, or vaccinated even if you can’t provide these items.

You can't be billed for COVID-19 vaccinations. If you receive a bill, you should first speak to the person or facility that sent it. If they don’t cancel it, contact the HHS Office of Inspector General Hotline at 1-800-HHS-TIPS or visit https://t.co/K7iRVjkSqa to file a complaint

Everyone is eligible for COVID-19 services, no matter their immigration status. Testing, treatment or vaccinations paid for by the federal government will not affect anyone’s immigration status or be shared with immigration agencies.
RT @Surgeon_General: This week I’ve spoken with community organizers, faith leaders, and many of you about J&J and #COVID19 vaccines. Today…
These funds will support expanded #COVID19 vaccination access; testing, contact tracing, PPE access, and treatment; preventive services; telehealth; and the broader IHS infrastructure. /2
This week I’ve spoken with community organizers, faith leaders, and many of you about J&J and #COVID19 vaccines. Today, I’ll share answers to 3 of the most common questions. https://t.co/gylbx5hAMS

In today's episode of family and work colliding, I was unexpectedly joined by an adorable guest to talk about the J&J vaccine pause and why our confidence in #COVID19 vaccines remains high. Bottom line: vaccines remain our greatest opportunity to turn the pandemic around. https://t.co/kwJ0ydnIxY
Today, many of you heard news about the Johnson & Johnson #COVID19 vaccines. You may have questions, so I'd like to talk with you about what we know so far. https://t.co/yZBea5ywxx

Did you know that safety is a top priority for #COVID19 vaccines? All vaccines must meet strict standards for safety before they can be used in the U.S. Get the facts: https://t.co/XrpJbBbOIL #WeCanDoThis
Did you know that #COVID19 vaccines teach our bodies to fight the virus that causes COVID-19 without us having to get the illness? Get the facts: https://t.co/XrpJbBtq7l #WeCanDoThis

As we close out the week, I want to share three numbers & one story with you. I’ll do this from time to time to keep you updated on how we’re doing on our collective journey to end the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/DI1iMRvlpc

We don’t talk enough about the pandemic's impact on mental health & its profound effect on young adults. Tune in today for a conversation about #CopingWithCOVID hosted by @USCAnnenberg. https://t.co/UVdAMPfn32
An estimated nearly 40,000 children in America lost a parent to #COVID19, according to a new model. Black children were disproportionately affected. (1/x)
#COVID19 vaccines represent our greatest chance to turn around this pandemic and get back to our friends, our work, and our lives. https://t.co/FWydsNAqcO
Join me for a live briefing with the White House COVID-19 Response team @WHCOVIDResponse now. https://t.co/8MCppdNnOV

We just announced the COVID-19 Community Corps—a nationwide grassroots network of local trusted voices to encourage Americans to get vaccinated. 

We all have a role to play in empowering our community to make healthy decisions. Grateful to @VP for her dedication to public health https://t.co/46x0ACmNHc
